pr_title: Documents that ContextStorage.current can return null

timeline.message: Fixes ThreadLocalContextStorage to return root Context if not set on current thread

timeline.bodyText: I think we can simply remove this line, we check for null in the Context and this is not necessarily.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: And add to the javadoc this behavior.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Ok, if it's expected that ContextStorage#current can return null it feels like I should also add the @Nullable annotation so that developers can expect this.
replies.author: HaloFour

replies.bodyText:
Are you suggesting to change this Javadoc on ContextStorage#current?  It implies that this method will never return null:
  /**
   * Returns the current {@link DefaultContext}. If no {@link DefaultContext} has been attached yet,
   * this will be the {@linkplain Context#root()} root context}.
   */

Also feels weird that it calls out DefaultContext given that's a package-private class.
replies.author: HaloFour

replies.bodyText: That's why I'm asking for clarity, because if it's expected that ContextStorage#current can return null then the Javadocs on that method should be updated to reflect this, and the method should be marked as @Nullable.
replies.author: HaloFour

replies.bodyText:
What is more

ThreadLocalContextStorage sets the ThreadLocal to Context.root() within the static constructor

this seems to be useless then and could be removed.
CC @anuraaga
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: I've committed the suggested changes, which more or less reverses what the PR was intended to do so I've changed the description of the PR (if that's ok).
replies.author: HaloFour

timeline.message: Change docs on ContextStorage.current to indicate that it can return null

timeline.author: anuraaga
